instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 8.2V
threads.message:
Hello,
This macbook came in for no power. The board is clean . no corossion.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 8.2V
PP3v42 is 3.4V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is is 3.4V

Where do i start checking.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 8.2V
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> first.

Check <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>1V25_S5_SMC</SIGNAL>
Do you have oscillation at Y5110?
Check when pressing power button too.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 8.2V
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> is okay.

Didoe Mode Reading is .543.
Voltage is 3.4V

<SIGNAL>AVREF_SMCIS</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S5_SMC_VDDC</SIGNAL> is 1.23V

I dont have the tools to check oscillation.

1 more thing. i did not have the Magsafe light yesterday but today there is light on the charger

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 8.2V
threads.message:
Do you get correct <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> signal no?
What is the exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage (without battery)?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 8.2V
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.19V Exact.

What do you mean by correct smc-reset signal ?

Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 8.2V
Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 8.2V
threads.message:
"I dont have the tools to check oscillation"
No need to use oscilloscope for that.
When Y5110 oscillates, you should find 1-1.2V DC voltage there.

Check voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines o9f battery bus.
If both look good, you should try to reball/replace the SMC.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 8.2V
threads.message:
Very strange - but i just plugged in the chagrer and now u get 8.6V on the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> nd i get a fan spin.

The fan spin increased gradually. 

Installed the board back to the chasis. Switched on.

threads.message: Obviously it wont last. What should i do. Should just wait for it to go back dead.
